Question 1.Question: The most important factor that delayed the development of commerce in Nigeria was
Question 1.Explanation: Commerce can be defined as all the activities involved in buying and selling of goods and the distribution of goods and services to the final consumers. The unavailability of sufficient infrastructural facilities is the most essential factor that hindered the development of Commerce in Nigeria.

Physical form of raw materials into finished goods

Question 2.Question: Secondary production has to do with changing the
Question 2.Explanation: Secondary production is a type of production in which the physical form of raw materials is converted into finished goods. It is also known as Manufacturing Industry. Question 3.Explanation: An entrepreneur is the risk bearer in a business. He is the factor of production that employs and controls all other factors of production. The reward for an entrepreneur is profit or loss.

Question 45.Question: The difference between a factor and a broker is that the former
Question 45.Explanation: The difference between factor and broker is that the former has a lien on the goods he possesses. Factors and Brokers are both and equally agents; but with this difference: the Factor is entrusted with the property which is the subject-matter of the agency; the Broker is only employed to make a bargain in relation to it. This means that, a broker does not take the possession of goods while a factor takes title of the goods

Question 46.Explanation: A void contract is referred to as contract which is devoid of its legal act.A voidable contract is a formal agreement between two parties that may be rendered unenforceable for a number of legal reasons.
